meanings.definition: A conqueror, especially one of the Spanish soldiers who conquered Mexico, Peru, and other parts of Central and South America in the 16th century.
meanings.sent1: The conquistador bravely led his troops into battle.
meanings.sent2: The conquistador's armor gleamed in the sunlight as he rode into the unknown lands.
meanings.sent3: The conquistador tried to conquer the mountain of homework on his desk.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like that of a conquistador, never giving up until she achieved her goal.
meanings.sent5: The image of the conquistador standing victorious on the battlefield was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: A leader in the Spanish conquest of America.
meanings.sent1: The conquistador strategized the next move for the troops.
meanings.sent2: As a conquistador, he inspired his soldiers with tales of glory and riches.
meanings.sent3: The conquistador jokingly declared himself the king of the lunch table.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a true conquistador in the world of business, always seeking new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher acted like a conquistador, conquering the students' attention with engaging lessons.
